oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Model 1863 Springfield rifle-musket
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This 1863 Springfield rifle-musket belonged to Corporal Lorenzo Dow Atwood, Co. D, 43rd Wis. Infantry Regiment, USA. The 43rd was stationed at Johnsonville Tennessee on the Tennessee River on Nov. 4, 1864 when attacked by Confederate cavalry under Gen. Nathan Bedford Forrest. The 43rd Wis. Infantry Regiment was part of the permanent garrison of Johnsonville. The 1863 Springfield was issued to some Federal units late in the war and was .58 caliber. This ramrod is not original to the 1863 Springfield rifle-musket.
